comments.author: Michael Read

comments.text:
+bugattirocksful I'm 16 and my daily driver and weekend road tripper is a 
1990 Mercedes Benz 300TE. I put about 700Km on her every week. Before I 
even bought the car the original owner said the radio died so I put in a 
Sony radio. I don't have leather seats so I can't fend for that but my 
Grand parents used to have a 2000 Cadillac Seville and a 1995 Sl 500 AMG. 
They hated the cadillac, after three years they traded it in for a 2003 
E350 and still drive that car. As for the AMG they traded that in and now 
drive a 2011 SLK 55 AMG. My Dad drives a 1988 300D and my Mom drives a 2006 
B200 Turbo. I can fend for these cars. I know that GM is awful because of 
not only media but family experience. GM is mass produced and there's no 
quality control.
comments.author: Michael Read

comments.text:
I still don't know what you're on if you think Mercedes is shitty stuff. 
Mercedes is the most well known luxury car brand in the world.. They have 
some extremely famous cars from the 80's and 90's that still run better 
than most Chevys and Fords..
comments.author: Michael Read

comments.author: mercstealthdk

comments.text:
I bought a 1982 Ford LTD Country Squire wagon, 351ci, for towing a class 1 
trailer and a small SCCA formula car.  I then added sway bars, better 
shocks, airlift bags for towing (leveling), dual exhausts, replaced the 
awful variable venturi carb with a Holley carb and Edelbrock intake (torque 
model), biggest possible radiator with electric fan, large external 
transmission oil cooler, comfortable cloth front seats, replaced the 14" 
wheels with 15" x 8" and the biggest (widest) radial tires that would fit. 
 I put 200K+ miles before I sold it to a local band that wanted to carry 
the members (rear opposing seats) and a trailer for the instruments/lights. 
 They have put another 100K+ miles on that yellow wagon with just basic 
maintenance.﻿

comments.author: 05EVORS

comments.text:
+0090cl Actually it is a Volvo and it IS a nice ride.
As long as you are having fun. why hate?
I was raised on SMC's in the 60/70's BUT there is a replacement for 
displacement and it can be in a 1988 car that will go one million miles.
#needforswede
comments.author: Jerry Mael

comments.text:
Secondly, everyone with a non-American car thinks his car is the shit and 
he can't even have a decent car meet without talking shit. You guys are too 
hotheaded and you jump on every bandwagon that comes around. At first, it 
was the evo, then it was the supra. Now its the GTR. It'll be something 
else and then something else. These old cars aren't just cars, they are 
part of our heritage. Heritage. Something you new-school, preppy kids know 
nothing about. While you are talking shit, we are cruising in our old 
muscle cars that we built with our fathers and with a little TLC, will look 
way better than any foreign car on the road. If you gave me a 900hp evo, 
I'd sell it and get an old school muscle car ANY DAY OF THE WEEK, fix it 
up, and ride.
comments.author: 0090cl

comments.text:
You're trying to communicate this to a crowd that doesn't give a fuck 
lol... This channel in itself is devoted to big MUSCLE. Yeah, there are 
faster 2 liter engines out there, but we don't care. Every day there is a 
honda with a turbo bigger than the engine, passing v8 cars... Does anyone 
care? No. It's faster, yes. But it's about the ride dude. The ENTIRE ride. 
No one cares about a car that is nothing without a massive turbo. We care 
about displacement. Loud and proud displacement. Cubic inches bigger than 
the ego of a ricer with a 88mm turbo in  his little family car.
comments.author: 0090cl

comments.text:

comments.author: ComedyHorse

comments.text:
Back in the mid-'80's, the guys who did roadtested Corvette developments 
for GM got tired of their Suburban support trucks not being able to keep up 
with their test vehicles, so they dropped a Corvette driveline, along with 
a few chassis mods from a Cadillac limo, into an '84 Caprice wagon.  When 
it was done, it had a top speed of 150.﻿
comments.author: Paul McCool

comments.text:
lots of people have done this,are you generalizing or talking about a 
specific vehicle and what chassis mods would you put on a vehicle from a 
limo ,the hot tub maybe??another thing,support vehicles dont need to and 
dont keep up to the vehicles being tested,the idea of this is flawed and 
fucking stupid.did you dream the entire thing up then spew it out on a 
youtube video instantly turning yourself into an ass.

 the 84 caprice wagon came with v8's originally and would accept any 
Chevrolet v8 ,transmission and rear end without any modifications so what 
your describing has been done virtually 100,000s of times. damn near any 
American car can go 150 mph pretty much effortlessly just by disabling the 
limiters.

hell my friend had a tubbed astro van with a 454 big block,another has a 
k-car with a rear wheel drive conversion and a 440 6 pack

comments.author: Wrench Rocker

comments.text:
A friend of mine actually has one of these, and I'm planning to buy it.  
Someone is going to give me a cam for it, with a final lift (lift to valve) 
of 454/454.  What time and speed do you think it's gonna do on the quarter 
mile in comparition?﻿
comments.author: Anthony Turenne

comments.text:
Thanks.  But in fact I know it, but my question was really badly formulate 
(I was really tired when I wrote it), and I don't really remember what I 
really tried to ask.  But I don't think I will need to anything else with 
the new cam, because it's not a big difference (about 20% at max 
potential), and I choose it because it was just a little difference, I 
don't want it to consume more gasoline and I want to keep it reliable.  
Actually I was thinking I would need to change the timing, but a friend of 
mine, a professional racing guy (and one of my teacher when I was at 
mechanic school) told me it won't be necessary to change it, it's not 
enough of a difference.  But as well thanks, always fun to share some 
advice.
comments.author: Anthony Turenne

comments.text:
it wont go much faster than it already does unless you change the 
exhaust,timing and other things to get a combined improvement.
remember that you will need the correct  new lifters for this,if they are 
used and not in the correct order when you install it,it will run worse 
instead of better.
comments.author: trillriff-axegrinder

comments.text: I'll see for that, thanks!  Hope it's not too expansive.
comments.author: Anthony Turenne

comments.text:
Summit or Jeggs used to sell a "Virtual Dyno" program That you could input 
your motor specs, vehicle weight, tire size and gear ratio, it would give 
you an estimate for Horse power, torque and quarter mile times. I think you 
could even put in your elevation above sea level, ambient air temp, air 
pressure, and humidity. I think it was even called "Virtual Dyno".
comments.author: Edmund Squid

comments.text:
+earsneyes43 In fact I know, I'm a mechanic, but I ask my question wrongly 
and realised it when you answered.  I was tired and I don't really remember 
what I tried to ask.  But sure thanks.
comments.author: Anthony Turenne

comments.text:
Too many variables not known, and unless you know the power at the wheel 
and the weight of the car at the time you run it, you won't know how fast 
it will be down the quarter.
